books_list.title: The E-Myth Revisited
books_list.author: Michael E. Gerber
books_list.favorite_quote: "The true product of a business is the business itself"

books_list.title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry into Values
books_list.author: Robert M. Pirsig
books_list.favorite_quote: "The real cycle you're working on is a cycle called 'yourself.'"

books_list.title: Ender's Game
books_list.author: Orson Scott Card
books_list.favorite_quote: "Sometimes lies were more dependable than the truth."

books_list.title: The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master
books_list.author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
books_list.favorite_quote: "One broken window, left unrepaired for any substantial length of time, instills in the inhabitants of the building a sense of abandonment -- a sense that the powers that be don't care about the building."

books_list.title: Effective Programming: More Than Writing Code
books_list.author: Jeff Atwood
books_list.favorite_quote: "People spend their entire lives learning how to write effectively. It isn’t something you can fake. It isn’t something you can buy. You have to work at it."

books_list.title: Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us
books_list.author: Daniel H. Pink
books_list.favorite_quote: "When money is used as an external reward for some activity, the subjects lose intrinsic interest for the activity."

books_list.title: Do More Faster: TechStars Lessons to Accelerate Your Startup
books_list.author: Brad Feld, David Cohen
books_list.favorite_quote: "a smart-ass team with a kick-ass product in a big-ass market."

books_list.title: Anything You Want
books_list.author: Derek Sivers
books_list.favorite_quote: "Don't be on your deathbed someday, having squandered your one chance at life, full of regret because you pursued little distractions instead of big dreams."

books_list.title: Don't Make Me Think: A Common Sense Approach to Web Usability
books_list.author: Steve Krug
books_list.favorite_quote: "Any design idea--no matter how appallingly bad--can be made usable in the right circumstances, with enough effort"

books_list.title: Smalltalk Best Practice Patterns
books_list.author: Kent Beck
books_list.favorite_quote: "A pattern is a decision an expert makes over and over."

books_list.title: Brave New World
books_list.author: Aldous Leonard Huxley
books_list.favorite_quote: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin."
